intro: Thespesia debeerstii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture. Thespesia debeerstii plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
